meanings.definition: The quality of being easily broken or shattered.
meanings.sent1: The frangibilities of the glass ornaments made them prone to breaking.
meanings.sent2: Handle the delicate china with care to avoid its frangibilities.
meanings.sent3: The frangibilities of the cookie jar were put to the test when it slipped from my hands.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt like it was made of frangibilities, ready to shatter at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The frangibilities of the ice sculpture were evident as it melted under the hot sun.

meanings.definition: The state of being fragile or delicate.
meanings.sent1: The frangibilities of the newborn bird made it vulnerable to harm.
meanings.sent2: The frangibilities of the lace fabric required gentle handling.
meanings.sent3: The frangibilities of the soap bubble made it pop with the slightest touch.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams felt like delicate frangibilities, easily shattered by reality.
meanings.sent5: The frangibilities of the spiderweb were evident as it swayed in the breeze.
